newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ Court of Appeal rejects John Barlow's appeal.
newsitem.headline: NZ Court of Appeal rejects John Barlow's appeal.

text.p: Hugh Barlow, brother of convicted double murderer John Barlow, said on Wednesday John Barlow is likely to take the case to the Privy Council, after the Court of Appeal rejected an appeal against his convictions.
Former Wellington businessman John Barlow is serving a life sentence with a minimum non-parole period of 14 years for murdering Eugene and Gene Thomas in February 1994.
A third court trial following two hung juries found him guilty of killing the father and son in their offices on The Terrace in central Wellington.
